task.summary: Add request and response to meta v0.2.0-beta.4
set refreshing value only if previously set
Set force:true when actually refreshing instead of implicitly forcing when refreshing:true
If no previous request was fulfilled, both `pending` and `refreshing` will be set
Fix PromiseState.all.reason to only return first reason
Upgrade Travis to use Node 5 to fix linting issues
Add and use methods to PromiseState for parity with Promise
Add meta to then() and catch().
Change to then, catch, andThen, andCatch

Add Support for Identity Requests
Implements #33

This implements "identity requests" as described in #33. See [Identity Requests: Static Data & Transforming Responses](https://github.com/heroku/react-refetch/blob/ab2989d5dd643b9081934f375aea0dccf4486b95/README.md#identity-requests-static-data--transforming-responses) for an explanation and example.
Note, this is not meant to handle the use case in #18 for post-processing (e.g. handling CSV responses) options. There is surely some overlap, but this is for transforming responses after any post-processing.

Treat identity request responses as resolved promises
Instead of bailing out of of refetchDatum() for identity requests, this changes the logic to first create a resolved promise and then handle them the same as HTTP response to support composition and other post-response handlers. This simplifies the promise chain and fixes a potential bug with network error handling previously introduced with metadata support. This is also a step in the direction to provide for generic request handlers as this moves out some of the HTTP-specifics.

Treat identity request responses as resolved promises
Instead of bailing out of of refetchDatum() for identity requests, this changes the logic to first create a resolved promise and then handle them the same as HTTP response to support composition and other post-response handlers. This simplifies the promise chain and fixes a potential bug with network error handling previously introduced with metadata support. This is also a step in the direction to provide for generic request handlers as this moves out some of the HTTP-specifics.

Treat identity request responses as resolved promises
Instead of bailing out of of refetchDatum() for identity requests, this changes the logic to first create a resolved promise and then handle them the same as HTTP response to support composition and other post-response handlers. This simplifies the promise chain and fixes a potential bug with network error handling previously introduced with metadata support. This is also a step in the direction to provide for generic request handlers as this moves out some of the HTTP-specifics.

Add cause to errors to provide access to arbitrary fields
This replaces the `id` field on errors with the full error in a `cause` field. It also returns the error as a rejection rather than a throw in the Promise. Finally, it replaces the unhelpful stringifiation of error with a `message` or `error` field to just an empty string.
Correct and refactor promise handling for meta and errors
Set identity requests to pending before firing off Promise
Add missing prop param in rejection handler
Passthrough provided meta in identity requests

Add then and catch mappings

v0.5.0 chainable requests
Add redirect support
Add redirect support @ v0.6.0

Add Support for Identity Requests
Implements #33

This implements "identity requests" as described in #33. See [Identity Requests: Static Data & Transforming Responses](https://github.com/heroku/react-refetch/blob/ab2989d5dd643b9081934f375aea0dccf4486b95/README.md#identity-requests-static-data--transforming-responses) for an explanation and example.
Note, this is not meant to handle the use case in #18 for post-processing (e.g. handling CSV responses) options. There is surely some overlap, but this is for transforming responses after any post-processing.

Treat identity request responses as resolved promises
Instead of bailing out of of refetchDatum() for identity requests, this changes the logic to first create a resolved promise and then handle them the same as HTTP response to support composition and other post-response handlers. This simplifies the promise chain and fixes a potential bug with network error handling previously introduced with metadata support. This is also a step in the direction to provide for generic request handlers as this moves out some of the HTTP-specifics.

Add cause to errors to provide access to arbitrary fields
This replaces the `id` field on errors with the full error in a `cause` field. It also returns the error as a rejection rather than a throw in the Promise. Finally, it replaces the unhelpful stringifiation of error with a `message` or `error` field to just an empty string.
Correct promise handling post-merge
Correct and refactor promise handling for meta and errors
